TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract OLEDBConnection

Docs.summary: Represents the OLE DB connection.

remarks.para: An OLE DB connection can be stored in an Excel workbook. When Micrososft Excel opens the workbook, Excel creates an in-memory copy of the OLE DB connection known as the object.

An object contains information related to the connection, such as the name of the server to connect to and the name of the objects to be opened on that server. Optionally, the object may also include authentication credential information, or a command that is to be passed to the server and executed (for example, a SELECT statement to be executed by SQL Server).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ADOConnection As Object
public: property System::Object ^ ADOConnection { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an ADO connection object if the PivotTable cache is connected to an OLE DB data source. Read-only.

remarks.para: The property exposes the Microsoft Excel connection to the data provider, allowing the user to write code within the context of the same session that Excel is using.

The property is available only for sessions where the data source is an OLE DB data source. When there is no ADO session, the query will result in a run-time error.
The property can be used for any OLE DB–based cache with ADO. The ADO connection object can be used with ADO MD for finding information about OLAP cubes on which the cache is based.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AlwaysUseConnectionFile { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Trueif the connection file is always used to establish connection to the data source. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: When this property is True the connection file will always be used to establish the connection to the data source. If the connection embedded within the workbook is different from the external connection file, the embedded connection will be ignored and the external connection file will be the only version considered.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: When used without an object qualifier, this property returns an object that represents the Microsoft Office Excel application. When used with an object qualifier, this property returns an Application object that represents the creator of the specified object. Read-only.

remarks.para: You can use this property with an OLE Automation object to return the application of that object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool BackgroundQuery { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if queries for the OLE DB connection are performed asynchronously (in the background). Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources, this property is read-only and always returns False.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CalculatedMembers As CalculatedMembers

Docs.summary: Gets the collection for the specified connection.
Docs.value: The collection for the specified connection.

remarks.para: Read-only.
Use the property of the collection to share calculated members between multiple PivotTables and cube functions that use the same connection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CancelRefresh() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Cancels all refresh operations in progress for the specified OLE DB connection.

remarks.para: Use the property to determine whether a refresh operation is currently in progress.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ CommandText { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the command string for the specified data source. Read/write Object.

remarks.para: You should use the property instead of the SQLproperty, which now exists primarily for compatibility with earlier versions of Microsoft Excel. If you use both properties, the property's value takes precedence.
The property describes the value of the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCmdType CommandType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCmdType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCmdType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets one of the XlCmdType constants. Read/write .

remarks.para: The constant that is returned or set describes the value of the property. The default value is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Connection { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a string that contains OLE DB settings that enable Microsoft Excel to connect to an OLE DB data source. Read/write Object.

remarks.para:
Setting the property does not immediately initiate the connection to the data source. You must use the method to make the connection and retrieve the data.
When using an offline cube file, set the property to True and use the property instead of the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As XlCreator

Docs.summary: Returns a constant in the enumeration that indicates the application in which this object was created. Read-only.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns the string XCEL, which is equivalent to the hexadecimal number 5843454C. The property is designed to be used in Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Excel has the creator code XCEL.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableRefresh { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the connection can be refreshed by the user. The default value is True. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: The property is ignored if the property is set to False.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsConnected As Boolean
public: property bool IsConnected { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns True if the property isTrue. Returns False if it is not currently connected to its source. Read-only Boolean.

remarks.para: The property does not check to see if the connection is connected. Even if this property returnsTrue, sending commands to the provider could result in an error if the connection is no longer valid.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ LocalConnection { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the connection string to an offline cube file. Read/write Object.

remarks.para: For a non-OLAP data source, the value of the property is an empty string, and the property is set to False.
Setting the property does not immediately initiate the connection to the data source. You must first use the method to make the connection and retrieve the data.

The value of the property is used if the property is set to True. If the property is set to False, the property specifies the connection string for query tables based on sources other than local cube files.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int LocaleID { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the locale identifier for the specified connection.
Docs.value: The locale identifier for the specified connection.

remarks.para: Read/write.

Before you set the property to a new locale, you must set the property of the object to false. For information about valid Locale ID (LCID) values, search the MSDN website for "Locale IDs Assigned by Microsoft".

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MaintainConnection { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns True if the connection to the specified data source is maintained after the refresh operation and until the workbook is closed. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: The default value is True. If you anticipate frequent queries to a server, setting this property to True might improve performance by reducing reconnection time. Setting this property to False causes an open connection to be closed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void MakeConnection() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Establishes a connection for the specified OLE DB connection.

remarks.para: The method can be used when a connection drops and the user wants to reestablish the connection.
Various objects and methods might return a run-time error if the connection is dropped. Use of this method assures a connection before executing other objects or methods.
This method will result in a run-time error if the property of the specified OLE DB connection has been set to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxDrillthroughRecords { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the maximum number of records to retrieve. Read/write Integer.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OLAP As Boolean
public: property bool OLAP { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns True if the OLE DB connection is connected to an Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) server. Read-only Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent object for the specified object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reconnect() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Drops and then reconnects the specified connection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Refresh() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Refreshes an OLE DB connection.

remarks.para: When making the connection to the OLE DB data source, Microsoft Excel uses the connection string specified by the property. If the specified connection string is missing required values, dialog boxes will be displayed to prompt the user for the required information. If the property is False, dialog boxes are not displayed and the method fails with the Insufficient Connection Information exception.

After Microsoft Excel makes a successful connection, it stores the completed connection string so that prompts will not be displayed for subsequent calls to the method during the same editing session. You can obtain the completed connection string by examining the value of the property.
After the database connection is made, the SQL query is validated. If the query is not valid, the method fails with the SQL Syntax Error exception.
The method returns True if the query is successfully completed or started; it returns False if the user cancels a connection.
To see whether the number of fetched rows exceeded the number of available rows on the worksheet, examine the property. This property is initialized every time the method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RefreshDate As DateTime
public: property DateTime RefreshDate { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the date on which the OLE DB connection was last refreshed. Read-only DateTime.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources, this property is updated after each query.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Refreshing As Boolean
public: property bool Refreshing { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: True if a background OLE DB query is in progress for the specified OLE DB connection. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: Use the method to cancel background queries.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RefreshOnFileOpen { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the connection is automatically updated each time the workbook is opened. The default value is False. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: The connections are not automatically refreshed when you open the workbook by using the method in Visual Basic. Use the method to refresh the data after the workbook is open.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int RefreshPeriod { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the number of minutes between refreshes. Read/write Integer.

remarks.para: Setting the period to 0 (zero) disables automatic timed refreshes and is equivalent to setting this property to Null. The value of the RefreshPeriod property can be an integer from 0 through 32767.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RetrieveInOfficeUILang { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the data and errors are to be retrieved in the Office user interface display language when available. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: If this property is set to False, the LCID value in the connection string is used instead. If an LCID is not specified, the default LCID from the server is used.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlRobustConnect RobustConnect { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlRobustConnect get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlRobustConnect value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets how OLE DB connection connects to its data source. Read/write .

remarks.para: If you use robust connectivity, when Microsoft Excel is unable to establish a connection using the workbook connection information, Excel will check if the workbook connection has a path to an external connection file. If it does, Excel will open the external connection file and try to connect using the information contained in the external connection file. If a connection can be established after using the external connection file, Excel will then update the workbook's connection object.

This provides robust connectivity in scenarios where an Information Technology Department maintains and updates connections in a central place, permitting a user's workbook to automatically fetch those updates whenever the previous version of the connection (cached within the workbook) fails.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SaveAsODC (string ODCFileName, object Description, object Keywords);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SaveAsODC([in]string ODCFileName, [in]object Description, [in]object Keywords) runtime managed
Public Sub SaveAsODC (ODCFileName As String, Optional Description As Object, Optional Keywords As Object)

Docs.param: Description that will be saved in the file.
Space-separated keywords that can be used to search for this file.
Docs.summary: Saves the OLE DB connection as an Microsoft Office Data Connection file.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SavePassword { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if password information in an OLE DB connection string is saved in the connection string. False if the password is removed. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: This property is used in both ODBC and OLEDB queries, and by both PivotTables and QueryTables.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCredentialsMethod ServerCredentialsMethod { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCredentialsMethod get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCredentialsMethod value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the type of credentials that should be used for server authentication. Read/write .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ServerFillColor { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the fill color format for the OLAP server is retrieved from the server when using the specified connection. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ServerFontStyle { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the font style format for the OLAP server is retrieved from the server when using the specified connection. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ServerNumberFormat { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the number format for the OLAP server is retrieved from the server when using the specified connection. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ServerSSOApplicationID { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a single sign-on application (SSO) identifier that is used to perform a lookup in the SSO database for credentials. Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ServerTextColor { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the text color format for the OLAP server is retrieved from the server when using the specified connection. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SourceConnectionFile { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String indicating the Microsoft Office Data Connection file or similar file that was used to create the connection. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SourceDataFile { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String indicating the source data file for an OLE DB connection. Read/write.

remarks.para: For file-based data sources (for example, Access) the property contains a fully qualified path to the source data file. It is null for server-based data sources (for example, SQL Server). The property is set to null if the property is changed programmatically.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UseLocalConnection { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the property is used to specify the string that enables Microsoft Excel to connect to a data source. False if the connection string specified by the property is used. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: This example sets the connection string of the first PivotTable cache to reference an offline cube file.
